get-accounts-response.description: Lists accounts you can access and can create a support case for. The list also includes types of cases available for each account.

items.description: Details about available accounts and types of cases you can create.

categories.description: Lists basic data about case categories you can use to create a case for the account.

items.description: Categories of cases you can create a case for the particular account for.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the category. The possible options are `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, `BILLING`, or `TECHNICAL`.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.
Type of resource you can GET.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Case Management API

info.description: Manage support requests to resolve issues with your Akamai applications and services.
info.title: Akamai: Case Management API

get.description: Lists accounts you can access. The list also includes types of cases you can create for each account. You need this data to [Get a case category details](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) and [Create a case](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/post-cases).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

schema.description: Lists accounts you can access and can create a support case for. The list also includes types of cases available for each account.

items.description: Details about available accounts and types of cases you can create.

categories.description: Lists basic data about case categories you can use to create a case for the account.

items.description: Categories of cases you can create a case for the particular account for.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the category. The possible options are `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, `BILLING`, or `TECHNICAL`.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

post.description: Creates a new case for the support team. Run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation first to check what data you need for your case category and available options. Once you create the case, the support team responds based on the [service level agreement for initial response](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#service-level-agreement-for-initial-response) or terms of your service agreement or contract.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

schema.description: Encapsulated details of the case to create.

accountId.description: Identifier for the account you want to create the case for. To get this value, run the [List available accounts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-accounts) operation.

alsoNotify.description: Lists email addresses to send case notifications to.

items.description: Email address to send notifications about update notifications.

alternateContact.description: Specifies a person for the support team to contact, if you're unavailable. This person also gets notified about any updates to the case.

company.description: Name of the company the person works for.

areaName.description: Area name the case refers to. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`. To get available values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the category you want to create the case for. To learn more about available case categories, see [Categories of cases](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#categories-of-cases).

customerTrackingNumber.description: Identifier for a separate customer's support ticket.

parentAccountId.description: Identifier for the parent account to associate and share the case with. Provide it only when creating a `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT` case associated to an indirect contract. To get this value, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

partnerTicketNumber.description: Identifier for a separate reseller's support ticket, up to 30 characters.

policyDomainName.description: Name of the policy domain the case refers to. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `SECURITY`. To get available values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

problemName.description: Problem name the case refers to. This value depends on the `productName` value. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `TECHNICAL` or `SECURITY`. To get available combinations of `productName` and `problemName` values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

productName.description: Product name the case refers to. This value depends on the `problemName` value. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `TECHNICAL` or `SECURITY`. To get available combinations of `productName` and `problemName` values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

productSolutionName.description: Product solution name the case refers to. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`. To get available values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

psPackageName.description: Professional services package name the case refers to. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`. To get available values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

serviceName.description: Service name the case refers to. This value depends on the `areaName` value. Provide it only when the `categoryId` is set to `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`. To get available combinations of `areaName` and `serviceName` values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

severity.description: Severity level of the case. To get available values, run the [Get a case category](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-category) operation.

subject.description: Title of the case, up to 255 characters. Try to make it short and specific. This helps the support team to identify the case if you forget or don't have access to the case identifier.

schema.description: Collects details of the created case.

account.description: Specifies the account the case was created for.

alsoNotify.description: Lists email addresses to send case notifications to.

items.description: Email address to send update notifications to.

company.description: Company name. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

email.description: Email address. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

name.description: Full name. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

phone.description: Phone number. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

areaName.description: Area name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the category. The possible options are `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, `BILLING`, or `TECHNICAL`.

closedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was closed. It's `null` for cases with any `status` other than `CLOSED`.

contact.description: Collects data about the case's creator.

company.description: Name of the company the user works for. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

phone.description: Phone number. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

accountId.description: Identifier for the reseller's account. It's `null` if a reseller created the case for a third party.

accountName.description: Name of the reseller's account. It's `null` if a reseller created the case for a third party.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was created.

customerTrackingNumber.description: Identifier for a separate customer's support ticket. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was last modified.

nextAction.description: Specifies who should take the next action. The possible options are the person assigned to the case (`CASE_OWNER`) or a user (`CUSTOMER`). It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `TECHNICAL`.

parentAccount.description: Specifies the parent account of the indirect contract the case is associated with.

accountId.description: Identifier for the parent account. It's `null` for cases associated with an indirect contract and the `categoryId` is set to `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`.

accountName.description: Name of the parent account. It's `null` for cases associated with an indirect contract and the `categoryId` is set to `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`.

partnerTicketNumber.description: Identifier for a separate reseller's support ticket. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

permissions.description: Specifies your permissions for the case.

addComments.description: Whether you can add comments to the case.

requestClose.description: Whether you can request to close the case.

updateCase.description: Whether you can update the case.

policyDomainName.description: Name of the policy domain the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `SECURITY`.

problemName.description: Problem name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `TECHNICAL` or `SECURITY`.

productName.description: Product name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `TECHNICAL` or `SECURITY`.

productSolutionName.description: Product solution name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`.

psPackageName.description: Professional services package name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`.

resolvedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was resolved. It's `null` for any `status` other than `CLOSED`.

serviceContractId.description: Identifier for the service contract. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICE`.

serviceName.description: Service name the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`.

solutionSummary.description: Solution of the problem. It's `null` for any `status` other than `CLOSED`.

status.description: Current status of the case. The possible options are `CREATED`, `ASSIGNED`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `MITIGATED/SOLVED`, or `CLOSED`.

timeToInitialResponse.description: Time for initial response, in minutes. To learn more about it, see [Service level agreement for initial response](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#service-level-agreement-for-initial-response). It's `null` until the first communication from Akamai.

201.description: The response provides the created case.

Location.description: Relative path to the newly created resource.

get.description: Lists open or closed cases. You can filter the results to fetch only your cases or cases created by all users of your account. You can also limit the request to a specific number of cases or time period.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

parameters.description: __Enum__ Type of cases to fetch. You can filter the results for your cases, `MY_ACTIVE_CASES` or `MY_CLOSED_CASES`, or for all users of your account, `ALL_ACTIVE_CASES` or `ALL_CLOSED_CASES`.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Number of days in the past to fetch cases for. If omitted, the operation returns most recent cases matching values of the `type` and `limit` parameters.
parameters.name: duration

parameters.description: List of accounts to fetch the cases for. To get these values, run the [List available accounts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-accounts) operation. If omitted, Case Management fetches cases for all accounts you can access.
parameters.name: accountIds

parameters.description: Data rows to fetch starting from the most recent. The maximum number of items is `200`, `50` by default.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Cursor value for pagination. It occurs only if there's a `next` page of the results.

attachments.summary: Sample cursor value for navigating to the next set of paginated attachments

cases.summary: Sample cursor value for navigating to the next set of paginated cases

comments.summary: Sample cursor value for navigating to the next set of paginated comments

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Contains the list of cases matching the set filters.

items.description: Case details.

account.description: Specifies the account the case was created for.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the case category. The possible options are `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, `BILLING`, or `TECHNICAL`.

contact.description: Collects data about the case's creator.

company.description: Name of the company the user works for. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

phone.description: Phone number. It's `null` if the creator didn't provide this data in the request.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was created.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

policyDomainName.description: Name of the policy domain the case refers to. It's `null` for any `categoryId` other than `SECURITY`.

severity.description: Severity level of the case. To learn more about severity levels for different cases, see [Severity levels](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#severity-levels).

status.description: Current status of the case. The possible options are `CREATED`, `ASSIGNED`, `IN_PROGRESS`, `MITIGATED/SOLVED`, or `CLOSED`.

updatedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the case was last modified.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

patch.description: Updates the list of people to contact about the case. The alternate contact is the contact person if the case's creator is unavailable. The alternate contact and set of `alsoNotify` email addresses all receive notifications. Data provided in the body of this request replace the current contact details in the case.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

200.description: The response provides the details of updated case.

parameters.description: Identifier for each case. To get this value, run the [List cases](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-cases) operation.
parameters.name: caseId

post.description: Attaches a file to a specific case. Each case can have up to ten attachments, up to 2GB each. The response includes `uploadId` necessary to [GET the status of an attachment upload](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-attachment-upload-status).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

multipart/form-data.example:
POST /case-management/v3/cases/F-CS-000000/attachments HTTP/1.1
Content-Length: 155
Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=abcde12345

--abcde12345
Content-Disposition: form-data; name="attachmentContent"; filename="sample.txt"
Content-Type: text/plain

This is a sample file.
--abcde12345

schema.description: Content of the attachment you want to add to the case.

attachmentContent.description: Content of the attachment in the binary format.

example.uploadStatusMessage: Attachment is being uploaded to case. Please use the attachment_upload_status link to check the status.

schema.description: Provides details about the status of the attachment upload.

attachmentId.description: Identifier for each attachment. This appears only for attachments with the `UPLOADED` status.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

uploadId.description: Identifier for each attachment upload request.

uploadStatus.description: Status of the attachment upload. The possible options are `UPLOADING`, `UPLOADED`, or `FAILED`.

uploadStatusMessage.description: Detailed status of the attachment upload.

get.description: Fetches attachments added to a specific case. Use the `limit` parameter to limit the number of attachments.

parameters.description: Data rows to fetch starting from the most recent. The maximum number of items is `200`, `50` by default.
parameters.name: limit

post.description: Adds a comment to a specific case. You can comment on tickets up to 14 days after they're closed.

example.comment: What is the latest Update on this Case?

schema.description: Collects the comment you want to add to the case.

example.comment: What is the latest update on this case?

schema.description: Collects details about the comment added to the case.

commentType.description: Type of comment. The only supported value is `WEB_UPDATE`.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the comment was added.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

201.description: The response provides details of the comment.

Location.description: Relative path to the newly created resource.

get.description: Fetches comments added to a specific case. You can set the `limit` parameter as the maximum number.

schema.description: Provides details about comments added to the case.

items.description: Comment details.

comment.description: Comment content. Comments added in the Akamai Community are in the Rich Text format, so they may include HTML tags and entities here.

commentType.description: Type of the comment. The possible options are `EMAIL`, `ATTACHMENT`, or `WEB_UPDATE`.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the comment was added.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.
Type of resource you can GET.

parameters.description: Identifier for each case. To get this value, run the [List cases](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-cases) operation.
parameters.name: caseId

post.description: Sends a request to close a specific case.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

schema.description: Data needed to close the case.

comment.description: Additional context for closing the case, `Please close the case` by default.

example.comment: Case Closure Request: Please close the case

schema.description: Collects details about the comment added to the case.

commentType.description: Type of comment. The only supported value is `WEB_UPDATE`.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the comment was added.

rel.description: Type of resource you can GET.

201.description: The response provides the request's details.

Location.description: Relative path to the newly created resource.

parameters.description: Identifier for each case. To get this value, run the [List cases](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-cases) operation.
parameters.name: caseId

get.description: Returns data required to create a case for a specific case category. To learn more about available case categories, see [Categories of cases](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#categories-of-cases).

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Case Management API

parameters.description: Identifier for an account you want to get the category details for. To get this value, run the [List available accounts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-accounts) operation. The default value identifies your current account.
parameters.name: accountId

example.description: Get Akamai support on technical questions and break/fix issues you haven't been able to resolve through other tools or resources.

schema.description: Collects details about a case category.

account.description: Specifies the account you want to create the case for.

areas.description: Lists available area and service names combinations. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`.

items.description: Available combination of area and service names.

serviceNames.description: List of service names available for `areaName`.

items.description: Name of the service.

categoryId.description: Identifier for the category. The possible options are `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, `BILLING`, or `TECHNICAL`.

parentAccounts.description: Lists available parent accounts you can create a case for. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than  `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT` and for `BILLING` or `BUSINESS_SUPPORT` cases associated with a direct contract.

items.description: Available parent accounts.

policyDomains.description: Lists available policy domain, product, and problem combinations. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than `SECURITY`.

items.description: Available combination of policy domain, product, and problem.
Available product.
Available product problem.

productSolutionNames.description: Lists available product solutions. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`.

items.description: Name of the product solution.

products.description: Lists available product and problem names and severity level combinations. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than `TECHNICAL`.

items.description: Available combinations of product names, problem names, and severity levels.
Name of the problem.

severities.description: Lists available severity levels available for the product. To learn more about them, see [Severity levels](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#severity-levels).

items.description: Severity of the case.

psPackageNames.description: Lists available professional services packages. It's an empty array for any `categoryId` other than `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`.

items.description: Names of professional services packages.

severities.description: Lists severity levels available for the `SECURITY`, `BUSINESS_SUPPORT`, `PROFESSIONAL_SERVICES`, or `BILLING` case categories. To learn more, see [Severity levels](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/docs/about-case-management#severity-levels).

items.description: Severity of the case.

200.description: The response provides data necessary for creating a case.

parameters.description: __Enum__ Identifier for a category you want to get the details for. To get the list of categories available for an account, run the [List available accounts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/case-mgmt/reference/get-accounts) operation. If you enter a category not available for the account, the operation returns a 404 error.
parameters.name: categoryId

tags.description: List accounts you can create a case for.
tags.name: Accounts
